reviewText: This game is a good bit of dumb fun. The game can be pretty challenging sometimes, but not so difficult that you just give up. The cutscenes tend to be pretty humorous. If you take this game seriously, you're doing it wrong. The music is good and the art style is fitting. One gripe, the game almost requires a controller to play. The game will only let you move in four directions with the keyboard, so good luck beating the game. If you have a console controller, it is worth every bit of that small investment you have to make.

reviewText: Taking everything that is fun about shooters, and mixing it with crisp looking graphics and solid gameplay, 'Who's That Flying?!' will make make you love the genre all over again. With a quirky storyline straight out of a dimestore comic book, this game is filled with win. You are invincible, but the world around you is not. Don't let the doom beasts past or the city (and your ultra egotistical image) will be hurt, and there is only so much they can take. At budget price, with substance out the ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, its a no brainer purchase.

reviewText: I'm more of a wannabe developer than a hardcore SHMUP player, but Who's That Flying had me striving to get better.  The theme fits the mechanics well.  An invincible avatar fends off invaders before they can pass into the populace.  It's less about dodging bullets than shooting or bashing through targets.  While the special move limitations are explained away with a character flaw, it works.\n\nOptions are limited.  There is no windowed mode.  Keys can't be adjusted within the game.  Xbox 360 controllers are supported, but the B button's cancel operation is essentially the Esc button.  This hurts during play because it's easy to unintentionally pause or even erase progress in the current level.

reviewText:
Good shoot 'em up. The graphics are sharp (and look cool), it reminded me a lot of Alien Hominid. The game itself is, like I said, pretty good but straightforward. You just press and hold Space to shoot, ocassionally press X to use your powers and Control to grab bigger enemies (and press Space some more). The goal is to keep enemies from flying past you. If you let 50 pass, it's game over. If you can keep them off you're awarded a medal. So nothing groundbreaking.
However, I wish there was a little bit more variation in enemies (and enemy designs as well). But it's a solid game nonetheless. Would I recommend it ? No. Unless you're really into shoot 'em ups, that is.

[Rating: 62/100]

reviewText:
6/10

Pros:
- Is a 'real release' (Little or no bugs) ++
- Allows holding down button to shoot and has special attacks to add more depth and fun to the game.

Cons:
- No multiplayer (Not listed as multiplayer, but would add alot to the game).
- Has a survival type gamestyle which the whole game (Campaign/Story included) revolves around as a theme. This would not be a bad thing at all if the game had other modes/gametypes that were not ingrained in this particular mode/style, but it doesn't.

All in all this is a good 'small' arcade game, it has solid coding, can be fun, and has some genuine and creative content in the story/theme and gameplay. The thing for me that stops this game from being a great is mostly the lack of replayability/content.

reviewText: I thought really hard on this one, it's simple, kind of fun, and quirky in a good way.   If you can get it really cheap or free, it's worth it for the 20 minutes of fun you'll have.\n\nThe being an invincible shooter thing is  a nice twist, though the controls (on keyboard anyway) are horrendous. That being said, most of the enemies really try to annoy you instead of providing a legitimate challenge.   i.e. if you get hit by the 2nd world boss, you lose the battle because you will just be stuck there until the timer runs out.  So then you have to start the level again and keep going until you get a perfect.

reviewText: Who‚Äôs That Flying?! is a shoot um up games with a super hero theme. The story is basically that you are a wannabe superhero and have to prove yourself by defending various cities around the world. The story is very simplistic, but it is kinda funny in a cheesy way because the way the cutscenes are done. The voice acting is‚Ä¶ weird. You can barely understand any of it so you mostly have to read the text. Of course, this is a good thing. I think indie devs need to realize that bad voice acting is far worse than cheesy voice acting, or even none at all. Other than that, let's focus on what is important here, the presentation and gameplay. The graphics are pretty gorgeous  honestly, and it really does help the theme of ‚Äúsilly‚Äù. The animations are solid as well. The gameplay is pretty par for the course, but it‚Äôs still very effective and fun. In Who‚Äôs That Flying?! you will be blasting your way through 15 levels, in 5 different cities. Each one is very different than the last, with different enemy types. At the last level for each city, you have to fight a boss. The bosses are pretty challenging, but not rage inducing. Who‚Äôs That Flying!? only has keyboard support, as well as gamepad. So yeah, unfortunately there is no option to use the mouse. The actual gameplay is fun, and the object it to shoot the enemies before they fly by you. You have no health in this game, but instead the city has health. Let enough of them fly by you, and you will lose and the city will be destroyed. you only have one blaster in this game, and there are no upgrades. It does reward you for combos though. You have a specials bar that fills up, so you can get more powerful lasers for a short 5-10 second period. You win each level by flying to the end, and eliminating all the baddies. The game is pretty short as you could imagine, and it only takes about 2 hours to beat the main story. There is a challenge mode and a infinite mode if you really like the game, but by the time i beat it in 2 hours and 30 minutes i was pretty much ready to be done with it. Overall, Who‚Äôs That Flying?! is a pretty great little budget SHUMP game. I can definitely recommend it even if you are only slightly into the genre. WTF is nothing special really, but certainly a solid entry in the somewhat dying SHUMP genre.

reviewText: Whos that flying is one of the best side scrolling shooters i have ever played. It has a charm that cannot be denied and it works great for this game. The story is you the Earth guardian whos found guilty by the planet guardian league and its up to you to prove youre innocense and there are enemys called ravegers that you need to destroy. As you are invincible you cannot dye but if too many ravegers get past you you fail. The game is a lot of fun and should be checkd out because its one of the hidden gems that doesnt get a lot of recognition. The game has a cute art style, simple controls and a great difficulty spike that gets harder when you go on. Its definetly worth the money so check it out i give it a 9/10

reviewText:
And once you've thought that there weren't enough side scrolling 2D shooters out there, along comes Who's that Flying?! Although simple and mindless, it's actually fun. There's plenty of action going on at all times keeps it from getting stale. It offers a short cartoon campaign with a story to save different cities around the world. The goal is to keep 50 enemies from getting past you which is harder than it sounds on some of the levels. Add in a different assortment of boss battles and it's actually a real treat.

You get a special one-time powerful beam every time you kill a certain number of monsters, but the charge will deplete if an enemy gets past. It has controller support which is nice. And once you finish the campaign there are a couple dozen challenge levels and an infinite mode to keep you entertained even further.

The in-between time waiting for levels to load seemed a bit long though, but not overly excessive. Decent dollar menu game.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
If you like side-scrolling shoot 'em up games, then you will like this one.
Who's That Flying?! is a really fun game where it starts very simple, where the player shoots at incoming enemies, preventing them from destroying the town. Then becomes really engaging as the enemies start to shoot back and attention would need to be divided between dodging enemy attacks and landing your shots. If you're familiar with Touhou games, then Who's That Flying?! style of play should not be anything new.
Some points I liked about this game is the good cartoon looks, challenging at times, and the simplicity yet fun aspects.
The only negative side of the game is that controls cannot be reassigned.

reviewText:
NOT-Kid-Friendly:You‚Äôre killing alien invaders but there are inappropriate jokes all over the exposition scenes.

Dear Brother:This is such an amazing game with a lot of replay value. Getting a perfect in each stage is very rewarding. And just when you finish the main story of the game, a plethora of challenge stages opens up to be accomplished. Those challenges are really crazy! They put you in the most creative situations that really make you think about your strategy in blasting away the enemies.

Dear Wife:It‚Äôs actually a memorization/strategy game disguised as an action game but I don‚Äôt think that this would be something we can enjoy together for longer than a few minutes. It's a very fun game but I think we'd enjoy ourselves more with other memory/strategy games set in different genres.

My Last Thoughts: KEPT. It deserves a spot as it is one of the better games I played so far.
EXHILARATING. Not one alien can pass through or else you‚Äôll have to repeat the whole stage from the beginning in order to get a perfect score. This kept me on edge the entire game! Truly exciting!
BEST WITH GAMEPAD.

reviewText: This game is a departure from the side-scrolling shooter genre, while at the same time being a good hommage to its ancestral roots.  The endless waves of identical baddies are there, flying in bizarre formations, just waiting for you to blast them out of the sky.  What's different, however, is the sense of humor the game brings, and the fact that, unlike most shooters, your ship" (in this case
recommended: showboating Guardian of Earth) is invincible!  Getting hit by the baddies doesn't kill you; it only slows you down.  This doesn't mean there is no consequence for failure
hoursPlayed: however; If you let the little Ravager aliens escape
voteText: they will devour part of the population of Earth.  Let 50 of them pass
votesTotal: if you do get hit by them
votesFunny: they will slow you down and prevent you from shooting for a brief time. Being invincible does make the character feel much more epic and powerful
column16: unlike the old-school games where you pilot a fragile spaceship."
